definition.name: Slider
definition.purpose: Allow users to select a value or range of values within a defined minimum and maximum using a draggable slider UI.
definition.description: A customizable slider component built on top of Radix UI's SliderPrimitive. Supports both single-value and range selection, with configurable min, max, and default values. The component is styled for both horizontal and vertical orientations and is accessible and keyboard-navigable.

className.description: Additional CSS classes to apply to the slider root element.

defaultValue.description: The initial value or range of values for the slider.

value.description: The controlled value or range of values for the slider.

min.description: The minimum value of the slider.

max.description: The maximum value of the slider.

initial.data: Slider is rendered with the default or provided value(s), min, and max.

enabled: Dragging the thumb(s) to change value(s)

when.description: User drags a thumb along the slider track.

from.state: Slider at initial or current value

effects: The value or range is updated and onChange is triggered if provided.

definition.visualLayout: A horizontal or vertical track with one or more draggable thumbs and a colored range indicator.
definition.implementationNotes: Wraps Radix UI's SliderPrimitive. Handles both controlled and uncontrolled usage. Uses a utility function for class name merging and supports custom styling via className prop.
